channel.title: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?
channel.description: I want to make it so that the server uses a different client.java based on where the player is standing. How do I do that?

item.title: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

It still has to do that, except it will be in another file. There’s really no point, because if you design the client.java well enough, it won’t take long.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?

item.title: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, the whole thing I’m trying to do is make my client as small as possible so that the program doesnt have to loop through the entire thing to find out what functions/variables/methods/etc it needs

item.title: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?
item.dc:creator: @Patchumz Patchumz
item.description:
@Patchumz wrote:

I dunno how exactly, but i know what you’re talking about, if you split up the client.java into multiple sections (Like a successfull smart programmer would, not dumb private server only people that’ve never REALLY coded) they are easier to manage and edit and then also easier to run, compile, and create less lag, i would have to look it up, but for now, try using http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/index.html it helps me… just use a search or something.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?

item.title: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, its like this:

Servers get laggy when too many people log on because the program has to go through every line of code to find cases it needs

Solutions: Seperate the cases based on where the player is standing, so you dont wind up (For example) adding the case of searching a crate in lumbridge if your standing in falador.

How do you make it go to open run and use the java file you wrote for the sepatated cases?

…

Ask someone on forums…?

Read full topic

oki think you mean you wrote new .javas for places and you want it to define the area and teleport you to these places randomly… i think?

item.title: How do I make the server change the client.java its using while playing?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Like, I made a file named “duelArena” and one named “ardougne” and one named “lumbridge” and I wrote client.java 's for each of those specific places. I’m in the process of locating coords to define those areas and I wrote a coordswitcher but I cant make it run the client.java for the area the coordswitcher specifies.

Read full topic
